reviews.text: This is the type of place that you literally walk right past and not even know it's a crazy landmark. Don't get me wrong it does look beautiful and I'm sure people who appreciates cathedrals and churches will love it. For me it's definitely possible but you could take a great selfie in front of it
It's cool for pictures
Cartagena is a beautiful city. Stating it is rich in history would be an understatement. If you love traveling, especially the latin countries I highly recommend Colombia and Cartagena.

Beautiful square with colonial architecture. City hall building occupies one of the sides, also banks and small stores where tourists can find any sort of things. It is also close to San Pedro square and the iconic Clock Tower. It is a must if you are visiting the city.

Beautiful Wide Open Plaza
This is a large area that houses everything from the Old Customs House to the Hard Rock Cafe. There is a bit of an unsettling aspect to the plaza in that here is where much of the slave trade took place. There is evidence of that in the large circular balls around the plaza, to which the slaves were chained. Highly recommend that you take a walking tour of this plaza and so many of the other plazas in the walled city. We used Cartagena Connections and were extremely pleased with our guide, Jon.
Fun shaded square to get out of the Cartagena heat. Lots of vendors around selling water too. Good place to sit and people watch.
Lively bustling plaza.  Heart of historic Cartagena must see , lots of activity and shops etc.

This is the bustling center of old town Cartagena. There always seems to something happening here. You'll find dancers, vendors and a parade of locals and tourists passing through. Nearby, you can find coffee shops, restaurants and boutiques. The harbor and city walls are a short distance away. It's worth a visit at different times of day as the light and the mood of the square will change.

Check airbnb for a top floor apartment with balcony overlooking the park/plaza where all the action is at and way cheaper than a small stuffy hotel room..Early evening was the best time for people watching as the dance troupes visited the park and the wide assortment of food carts.
Picturesque square in the heart of Cartagena, shaded by mighty trees.

Tem peças muito bonitas antigas, de oro é de barro que vale a pena apreciar. A entrada é gratuita e tem guias a explicar a história das peças. A parte má é que é bastante pequeno, o que não é uma coisa necessariamente má. Vale a pena visitar.
bien

Magnificent place of worship, well constructed church, nice views of this ancient and historical Church in the walled city of Cartegana. This Church has nice interiors with nice seating arrangements and outside there are a few refreshment centres are available for visitors. Nice place.
A must see

Convento de Santo Domingo, an ancient , historical church in the walled city of Cartegana is very  beautiful  inside. It is a must vist place.
Outside the church there are a number of small eateries where people gather for refreshments & enjoyment. The main attraction opposite the church is the Botero statue .
La puerta es encantadora... ojala pudiera tener una asi.
muy bela

This place is very nice.  I would recommend visiting here. It's full of history and pretty fun for the family.  There is also a little store to buy water, ice pops and other stuff when you reach the top.  Though my favorite part is when you reach the top the breeze is amazing. So, the good part is done on to the cons.  

Make sure you wear good shoes it's allot of walking on an incline. You also should be aware of the amount of people at the entrance trying to see you hats and water. There's allot.  There's so much solicitation i was getting very annoyed.  But if that's fine with you. Go ahead the place is great.

Very cool castle/fort Worth checking out.  We arrived early in the morning to beat the heat.  This turned out of be a great idea, the only shade is in the caverns of the fort.  You will likely be bombarded by aggressive vendors upon arrival.  You may want to buy a water or two.  The fort is very cool with nice views of the city.  We opted to not take the tour as we speak English and had our 3 yr old son with us.  The tour would likely be worth it and offer more insights for history buffs.  My son enjoyed the cannons.

This was a great viewpoint to the city. I arrived just before midday it was hot but the breeze from some points was very refreshing.  The first itself besides it's construction and location has not much else to offer

Decided to go here on a whim and was very impressed. Cartegena is known for its beaches and the Old City, but this is a very good piece of history to give the island some historic background. Not to mention the views from the top are outstanding. Very interesting to see the point of view of history from a different country. I recommend checking this out. It'll give you a better perspective of this tourist town.

What a great place to visit. You can do audio tours, with a guide or just roam the place on your own. The views of the city from the top area are amazing. During sunny days it can feel really warm so be prepared!. I highly recommend it!

A beautiful place for book-lovers to hang out, with excellent coffee. Cool and calm, although it can get busy occasionally. The English books section should be expanded to at least a third of the store, since that is what most customers seem to be after, and one bookshelf is not really enough. The English range is also limited and a bit tired, which I don't really understand because the Spanish side is really good and extensive (with many translated versions of current English books). It feels like somebody is trying to keep the book side of the business relevant, but maybe they don't have the staff; in the day just two guys on the till and making coffee. The shop turns into a small restaurant in the evening, which I've not tried yet.
We loved visiting this quiet spot. The coffee was excellent and there was an impressive selection of books. The only caveat were the steep prices.
Wonderful coffee shop within a bookstore. Excellent and friendly service with affordable prices. A great way to start your day in Cartagena!

Cute bookstore with a cafe that has the best cold brew by huge Interesting apparatus. Good way to begin the day or to escape the heat for abit while browsing the books.
Value 3/5
Atmosphere 4/5
Service 4/5
Quality 4/5
15/20
Wonderful iced latte and cold brews amongst books. The people working there were very kind and patient with us.

Pretty great spot for some local pastry. They have passion fruit pastry with cheese. The pastry themselves are not very flaky, especially in the heat, but flavour are interesting and worth a try.
The most interesting thing here is Avena, basically taste like oat soaked in milk served chilled. Very tasty and cooling, makes a great snack or dessert.
Recommended!

I was never a fan of cheese bread.... until this place. My god. I had a friend come here every single morning for one week. The pan de bono was addicting. I bought 8 to take away before I left Cartagena. The bread is spongey and dusted with some sort of powder. The guayaba (guava) croissant is also delicious! Pan de yuca was good - but stiffer and not as soft. Do not leave Cartagena without trying the pan de bono!
I love this place but I think the Cubano pastel got my friend sick. Delicious spot, but be safe.
5 stars for the cheese ball! Minus one star for the “juice”.
Amazing pastries and kind staff. Great place to try guava and cheese pastry!

This is basically the McDonald’s of Colombia but way way better. Milkshake are delicious, more dense than the usual. Fries are top as well and they have a variety of burgers with Colombian flavors and styles. In general the quality is high. Can be a bit pricy comparing to other places.
Good sandwiches, at an ok price point. Worth a visit due the really nicely restorated interior
We had a nice meal here. Clean place with lifesaving-ly good air conditioning. Ok prices
Tradicional Fast-Food in Colombia.. Nice burguers.. Really good localization
Good hamburger from their special range (Callejera) though not as spicy as it looks. Cost was 15000 COP for the burger only. Good service.

A beautiful place for book-lovers to hang out, with excellent coffee. Cool and calm, although it can get busy occasionally. The English books section should be expanded to at least a third of the store, since that is what most customers seem to be after, and one bookshelf is not really enough. The English range is also limited and a bit tired, which I don't really understand because the Spanish side is really good and extensive (with many translated versions of current English books). It feels like somebody is trying to keep the book side of the business relevant, but maybe they don't have the staff; in the day just two guys on the till and making coffee. The shop turns into a small restaurant in the evening, which I've not tried yet.
We loved visiting this quiet spot. The coffee was excellent and there was an impressive selection of books. The only caveat were the steep prices.
Wonderful coffee shop within a bookstore. Excellent and friendly service with affordable prices. A great way to start your day in Cartagena!

Cute bookstore with a cafe that has the best cold brew by huge Interesting apparatus. Good way to begin the day or to escape the heat for abit while browsing the books.
Value 3/5
Atmosphere 4/5
Service 4/5
Quality 4/5
15/20
Wonderful iced latte and cold brews amongst books. The people working there were very kind and patient with us.

Nice balcony from which you have a great view on the street. Food was super delicious (we had the fish of the day and the vegetarian paella). The waiters were really nice and helpful and could even speak a few words English.

I ordered the “ filete de corvina” and it came with a vegetable cream soup. Both were very tasty. Ambient wasn’t great but pretty good. Service was very good. Definitely a good option if you are in this area of the city, not too many options. I would come back!
Second floor restaurant, a few small tables out on the balcony but friendly inside. Excellent French cuisine and compared with the restaurants at street level very reasonably priced.

Cocktails are excellent
Very good bread 
However - high season and half of the happy hour menu not available
Prices reasonable 
Service was slow for cocktails but ok for food... 
Food was nice (paella and meat)
Interior design is very basic compared to all the new places around.

Everything was great: the view, service, salad, ceviche, drinks - were all pretty good and we felt like we came to a great place to hang out until we ordered cheese cubes and fish from happy hour menu ...
That was not fish croquettes,  that was fried fish spam. Cheese was ok but had some sweet sauce on it, which made life difficult after fish spam. Come to think of it, life gets tough for a few minutes after a taste of fish spam. It experiences a rapid loss of velocity and sparkle, it makes you think of that horrible school teacher or a sweaty night when AC broke or that time when your first car ever (the beat up whatever you bought after saving for months) just stopped, without a warning ... 
We pretty much left after that although initially were going to hang out for a bit.

The door man is uninviting, so much so that I only had a couple of cocktails and left. I'm sure the place is fantastic food wise, but honestly the tone set by the door man was enough for me to feel unwelcome.

With that said, give it a shot, reservations are necessary and be sure to wear pants, no shorts.

Happy hunting fellow travelers!

Everything was great, with the exception of time: we waited a long for everything (table, food, drinks).
Place is beautiful though, and food amazing

The place is great for a dinner date, it has live music and the ambiance is excellent. Staff are friendly and attentive. I forgot the name of the meal but it was kind of local seafood soup, it was delicious. So was the fish fillet with sauce on top. The Pie de Coco was a must!

Beautiful upscale restaurant. Food and service was amazing. Feels like going back in time and visiting an old Cuban social club. The decor and even walking through the small front gate make you feel like your entering a different time and place. Definitely worth a visit. Business casual is normally the minimum expectation of attire.
One of the fine dinner places to go to if your visiting Cartagena. Ask for the specials and you won’t be disappointed. Oh don’t forget to put in your reservations.

This place may look like a dive, but it's the real deal. The staff is super attentive and noticed that we needed more light, or noticed that we didn't like the volume of the music. But the food! Really really tasty. Reasonable prices considering the quality of the dishes and ingredients. Great location too. All dishes had an English translation. If you're staying in the area, avoid the crowds in the old City for a night and enjoy a nice walk to El Muelle. I think you will be happy you did.

It was my first time visiting cartagena and thankfully before I went I did plenty of research.  There's definitely a lot of different places to visit specially when it becomes to food spots. i decided to give El muelle a tried based on the reviews I've seen. I actually liked it more than expected.  Food is nice and fresh, Service its outstanding. They really go above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your food. The view is amazing  during the day and night time as well. Prices are fair for whatever food you get. They also have parking on the side of the restaurant, a plus for sure.  Thank you guys we had a great time.

Food is always great, service is courteous and attentive to cater all your needs, location is good, the place is very active during daytime due to sun bathers and water sports in front of the restaurant; so what else to say? If staying in Cartagena this is a most-go place.

We had food poisoning in that restaurant. Avoid it even if it is conveniently located near the beach. Service wasn’t great too we had to wait almost an hour for our poisonous food. We still have a painful belly 2 days after ☠️
I went here a lot - good drinks and food on the beach with a upper level so you can look out over the sea

This is a 4.5 star restaurant. The fish was a little overcooked, but still insanely delicious. Fried plantain was out of this world. Coconut rice as good as expected. Portions are big and service is good. The place was packed at 2pm, which is always a good sign. Not a 5-star, but very authentic. I would highly recommend this place. 

Pro tip: Squeeze some lime on the fried plantain.

I came here with a few friends and ordered the vegetarian pasta. It was pretty much spaghetti with vegetables and plantain on the side. The meal was ok but it lacked flavour and tasted like something I could make at home.

This place is truly authentic and seeks to be genuine Cartagena cooking. I had the baby lobster tail platter. It was just perfect. Not too salty but not too simple. Excellent flavor. The coconut rice was lightly sweet and the fried plantains weren't overly sweet. Quick service and very attentive service. Easily one of the best places I've been to in Colombia.
Not worth the price anymore.  Seafood was lacking, and the fish was just okay.  There are much better places in Getsemani. Try Coroncoro if you care for the quality, variety of dishes and fair price
Delicious! Loved the casserole. Service was great, and everything we had was done well. Yummy
Spectular location on bay/marina in Manga. Food was excellent. Our initial server was VERY attentive to us. Then, he left and substitute forgot about us. Waited WAY TOO LONG for entries.

STUNNING SETTING! Despite what seems to be a mixup with our Saturday night reso, we nonetheless managed a waterside table at this lively (though half-full) restaurant at 9pm. Service was friendly (and many servers spoke English) and food arrived very quickly. Wine list very respectable and even one of the cheaper options we selected was very nice. One of our entrees could have been a bit warmer and the other (a generous paella) would have benefited from less salt, but the ambiance - including live music - more than made up for these minor nits and made for a memorable evening.

Do not attempt to dine here or make any plans around it. I made a confirmed reservation weeks ahead of time for tonight on our trip here from abroad on their website, and at mid-day today they cancelled it by email with no explanation — and did nothing when I called and the concierge called. They cancelled it so late that we had to scramble at the last minute in high season to find something else at an inconvenient time.
History, ambience, great good, live music, waterfront. Superb!

Best dinner experience in Cartagena. The place is magnificent. The food was very good. Waiters were friendly. 

Prices are expensive, but it was our honeymoon...

The best of Argentinian food. The meats are indescribably good. The live music is amazing. Service is great.

We were seated without a reservation and they were very accommodating. Would love to come back.

Great quality food, nice ambiance, highly attentive service and well priced for the quality of dishes. This is definitely on the higher end of the price spectrum for the average traveler, but it is still half the price of North American restaurants. Two apps, 18oz rib eye, two sides and a nice bottle of wine for $150 CAD with tip.

The food was terrible. The steaks were tough and sinew-y. The cuts were thick, but it doesn't matter when the meat was that badly aged. 

The octopus was also a bit on the over ripe side. 

The presentation of the food was very good. Their drinks were good, but the main course was the worst I've ever had.
Probably one of the best restaurants I've ever visited. All the meat dishes were amazingly delicious! The appetizers fresh and yummy. Great selection of wines! Highly recommended for a dinner!
Our party of 8 had dinner here. The food and the service were exquisite. The house special will likely be some of the best pork you've ever had.

Really nice restaurant, had tapas to start and fish for main. Tapas was very nice. The fish however was so well cooked, some of the best I have ever had. Staff were very attentive and we felt well looked after. Definitely recommend

Good restaurant, special thanks to the woman who serve us during the dinner this 29/01/19.
I didn't put 5 stars just because I found that only 2 desserts is too less for the menu. However, everything was good.

This is my all time favourite in Barcelona for more than 10 years. I love their Patatas Bhutan and the rice. Located right on the beach, it is always great to walk around the restaurant after lunch/dinner.

We do follow recommendations and this was definitely one of the best places we have been to. 
Quite place, lovely dinner with great food and superb service. 
We all had different plates and all cooked perfectly and nicely presented. Quantity great and very good price. Good food from start to desert, which is made by their own staff. Ask for wine suggestions.
Food was very good. We ended up here as Cape Diem was fully booked and I was so glad it was as the service here is much more of a higher standard!
